meanings.definition: Dirt or mud that is ingrained on a surface.
meanings.sent1: The children's clothes were covered in grunges after playing in the mud.
meanings.sent2: The old car had accumulated grunges in its wheel wells over the years.
meanings.sent3: The dog happily rolled in the grunges, much to the dismay of its owner.
meanings.sent4: The grunges on the window obscured the view of the garden outside.
meanings.sent5: She scrubbed the grunges off the kitchen floor until it sparkled.

meanings.definition: A style of rock music characterized by a dirty, distorted sound.
meanings.sent1: The band's new album features a mix of grunges and heavy guitar riffs.
meanings.sent2: Fans of grunges music often appreciate its raw and gritty sound.
meanings.sent3: The grunges blasting from the speakers made the whole room vibrate.
meanings.sent4: His voice carried the emotional weight of the grunges in the lyrics.
meanings.sent5: The concert was filled with energy as the band played their grunges hits.

meanings.sent1: If you don't wash your hands, they will grunges from playing outside.
meanings.sent2: The white shirt grunges easily when worn during outdoor activities.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy grunges itself in the mud every chance it gets.
meanings.sent4: The walls of the old house grunges quickly in the damp climate.
meanings.sent5: She watched as her clean shoes slowly grunges from walking in the construction site.
